title: Diagnostic Tool Connection

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
To connect the Triumph diagnostic interface to the motorcycle, remove the seat (see,
The diagnostic connector is located next to the fuse box.
The diagnostic connector is red in colour and is connected to a blanking plug.
The blanking plug is to prevent contamination.
Release the locking tab to release the diagnostic connector from the blanking plug.
Connect the diagnostic interface cable into the diagnostic connector
Service Tool T3880538 - Diagnostic Interface Cable
Connect the Triumph diagnostic interface into the diagnostic interface cable.
Service Tool T3880057 - Triumph Diagnostic Interface
When the diagnostic session is completed, disconnect the Triumph diagnostic interface and diagnostic interface cable.
Connect the diagnostic connector to the blanking plug.
